channel.title: Windows 7 - java not recognized?
channel.description:
Hello everyone. I recently bought a new laptop, which has the new Windows 7. I haven't been able to start any client i've downloaded since I got the pc. All of them give the same error; 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command. Sometimes with different clients the 'java' is something like 'javaw' or 'javac', depending on what clients i used. I Managed to get one client working, Silabgarza, by adding "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -cp in place of the 'start java'. But I tried it for other servers, and it doesn't work.
Before you start flaming me for not knowing what i'm doing, let me apologize for not being well versed in the language of computers. No, I don't know how to fix this, and it may be simple. But I am not one of those idiots that come here begging for help instead of at least trying to fix the problem on their own first. I tried, I failed.
1 more thing, In my environmental variables, I don't have a CLASSPATH or a PATH set up, under admin or system, so that may be the problem. I have jdk6u18.
Thanks for reading, 0wn4g3.

item.title: Windows 7 - java not recognized?
item.dc:creator: @mangalover51 mangalover51
item.description:
@mangalover51 wrote:

windows 7 does not support jdk java… “yet”

Read full topic

Sometimes with different clients the ‘java’ is something like ‘javaw’ or ‘javac’, depending on what clients i used.
